as.leap

Class LCQueryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • as.leap.LCQueryManager

  • public final class LCQueryManager
extends java.lang.Object
    * This class provides the ability to manage the LCQuery.

    • Method Summary

      • countInBackground

        public static <T extends LCObject> void countInBackground(LCQuery<T> query,
                                                          CountCallback callback)
        Counts the number of objects that match this query in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        callback - callback.internalDone(count, e) will be called when the count completes.

      • findAllInBackground

        public static <T extends LCObject> void findAllInBackground(LCQuery<T> query,
                                                            FindCallback<T> callback)
        Retrieves a list of LCObjects that satisfy this query from the server in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        callback - callback.internalDone(objectList, e) is called when the find completes.

      • getInBackground

        public static <T extends LCObject> void getInBackground(java.lang.Class<T> subclass,
                                                        java.lang.String objectId,
                                                        GetCallback<T> callback)
        Constructs a LCObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the server in a background thread. This does not use caching. This is preferable to using the LCObject(className, objectId) constructor, unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        subclass - The class of object to create.
        objectId - Object id of the LCObject to fetch.
        callback - callback.done(object, e) will be called when the fetch completes.

      • getInBackground

        public static <T extends LCObject> void getInBackground(LCQuery<T> query,
                                                        java.lang.String objectId,
                                                        GetCallback<T> callback)
        Constructs a LCObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the server in a background thread. This does not use caching. This is preferable to using the LCObject(className, objectId) constructor, unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        objectId - the object id for search
        callback - callback.done(object, e) will be called when the fetch completes.

      • getInBackground

        public static <T extends LCObject> void getInBackground(java.lang.String className,
                                                        java.lang.String objectId,
                                                        GetCallback<T> callback)
        Constructs a LCObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the server in a background thread. This does not use caching. This is preferable to using the LCObject(className, objectId) constructor, unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        className - The class of object to create.
        objectId - Object id of the LCObject to fetch.
        callback - callback.done(object, e) will be called when the fetch completes.
